unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities News: Smart Meter Rollout Gaining Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: **Energy and Utilities News: Smart Meter Rollout Gaining Momentum in Maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, November 8, 2024 – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment program, aimed at modernizing the state's power grid. A total of 5 lakh smart meters have been installed across Pune, Nagpur, and Nashik as of today, with a target of 20 lakh by December 31, 2024.
normalised: Mumbai, eighth November two thousand and twenty four – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (M S E D C L) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment program, aimed at modernizing the state's power grid. A total of five lakh smart meters have been installed across Pune, Nagpur, and Nashik as of today, with a target of twenty lakh by December thirty one, two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: The rollout, part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS), aims to reduce Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses and improve billing efficiency. Initial data suggests a reduction of approximately 15% in power theft in areas equipped with smart meters.
normalised: The rollout, part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S), aims to reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses and improve billing efficiency. Initial data suggests a reduction of approximately fifteen percent in power theft in areas equipped with smart meters.

unnormalised: "This initiative is crucial for providing reliable and affordable power to consumers, from the bustling streets of Mumbai to remote villages in Vidarbha," stated Mr. Joshi, Chairman of MSEDCL, during a press conference held at 11:00 hrs. today. Consumers can monitor their energy consumption in near real-time via the 'Urja Mitra' mobile app. The next phase of the project, commencing on 15/01/2025, will focus on integrating prepaid functionality for all new installations. The company plans to cover all 4.5 crore electricity consumers in the state by 2027. Discussions are also underway to offer time-of-day tariffs, potentially incentivizing off-peak consumption starting 01/04/2025.
